title: Artificial intelligence: Google declares dipping its toes in journalism waters
description: The Silicon Valley company declared in a statement released on Thursday, July 20,  it is in the early stages of developing artificial intelligence tools to help journalists write 'stories and headlines.'

title: In Greece, recurring fires as consistent as lack of prevention
description: If the forest fires appear to have been contained on Thursday, July 20, on the tourist island of Rhodes and in the west of Athens, the threats remain high across the country. Local meteorological services warn of a heightened risk of fires due to an upcoming heat wave.

title: EU commits €20 billion to Ukraine's defense
description: The sums will be made available gradually using the European Peace Facility mechanism.

title: 'In Kinshasa, pondu keeps you going until evening'
description: 'A world of street food' (4/6). In Marseille, Hugues Mbenda serves a very popular dish from the Democratic Republic of the Congo based on mashed and boiled cassava leaves.

title: Russia seeks 20 years in jail for Kremlin critic Navalny
description: Navalny, already serving a nine-year prison sentence, is Russian President Vladimir Putin's most prominent critic. A verdict is expected on August 4.

title: Tour de France: Asgreen beats disorganized peloton to stage win
description: Danish rider Kasper Asgreen clinched a win after the peloton failed to catch up with a four-man breakaway, as the Tour returned to flat roads.

title: US climate envoy John Kerry leaves Beijing empty-handed
description: After a three-day visit to China, against a backdrop of tense diplomatic relations, the US climate envoy failed to guarantee any new climate commitments from Beijing.

title: French student on trial for filming dying man in subway
description: An 18-year-old woman filmed the moment she discovered a man lying in a pool of his own blood. The video was then posted on social media by her boyfriend and his sister.

title: Travis King: What we know about the detention of the US soldier in North Korea
description: The 23-year-old soldier, who was being held in military detention in South Korea, crossed the demarcation line that runs through the peninsula, probably to escape disciplinary action.

title: France chooses third location for next-generation nuclear reactors
description: The French government now knows where it plans to build each of the next six EPR-2 reactors. Le Bugey, in eastern France, was the latest site chosen.

title: War in Ukraine: The Black Sea once again at the center of the conflict
description: Moscow announced that vessels heading for Ukrainian ports would from now on be seen as military targets. Meanwhile, Kyiv is stepping up its attacks on Crimea.

title: Macron and Borne reshuffle French government
description: In a reshuffle described as 'adjustments' to the government, the president and prime minister are expected to name a handful of new ministers. Borne's former top adviser Aurélien Rousseau was named health minister, he told Le Monde.

title: EU's Timmermans to step down for Dutch election bid
description: Timmermans, 62, is to step down after 10 years spent in Brussels. He is currently in charge of the EU's flagship 'Green Deal.'

title: Elisabeth Borne, prime minister in spite of everything
description: The treatment inflicted on the French prime minister is both cruel and unfair. Elisabeth Borne is not responsible for the absence of an absolute majority in the Assemblée Nationale. On the other hand, she knows how to live with it.

title: Women's World Cup: Hosts Australia and New Zealand kick off with wins
description: New Zealand stunned Norway to earn their first-ever World Cup win, while Australia, whose star Sam Kerr missed the match with an injury, beat Ireland.

title: Egypt's Sissi pardons researcher a day after three-year jail sentence sparked outcry
description: An Egyptian court on Tuesday had sentenced Patrick Zaki to three years' prison for 'spreading false news,' before announcing his release on Wednesday.

title: Greece limits hours at Acropolis and other tourist  sites due to extreme heat
description: The heat wave is expected to continue in the Greek capital until at least Sunday, with a peak of 43ᵒC predicted for Thursday.

title: Vietnam wants an energy transition without environmentalists
description: The fast-growing country has put five of its most influential climate activists in prison since 2021, while seeking Western aid for an energy transition.

title: 'North Africa is used to the heat waves Europe is now experiencing'
description: Omar Baddour, an expert with the World Meteorological Association, explains that due to a lack of data, the number of deaths in Africa related to extreme climate events remains unknown.

title: Juba, the old rival capital, becomes a refuge for thousands of Sudanese fleeing war
description: Since fighting broke out in Khartoum in mid-April, over 11,000 people have fled to South Sudan, where they are trying to rebuild their lives.

title: 'The development of women's football is central, as it allows the expression of new values'
description: As the Women's World Cup kicks off, Pauline Londeix, founder of the think tank O2 Sport, highlights the contribution of sports to renewing our representations of gender.

title: 'French Bukkake' case: Defendants tried for rape, pimping and human trafficking
description: At the end of the investigation, the prosecutor described a criminal scheme targeting young women and backed by the production of pornographic films. Seventeen people will have to appear before the criminal court.

title: Russian army still reeling from Wagner chief Prigozhin's failed mutiny
description: Nearly a month after the Wagner leader's abortive insurrection, Russia's military leadership still appears to be riddled with tension.

title: War in Ukraine: At least 20 wounded in overnight attacks in Odesa and Mykolaiv
description: Five children among those injured in the southern port city Mykolaiv as Russia targets this area for the third successive night since ending of grain deal.

title: Swedish embassy in Baghdad stormed and set on fire in protests over Quran burning
description: The protests on Thursday were called by supporters of a prominent cleric who were angered by plans to burn the Quran and Iraq flag in Stockholm.

title: Women's World Cup: Les Bleues approach tournament looking for breakthrough
description: After a period of tensions within the team, France is taking on the Women's World Cup in Australia and New Zealand under the guidance of a new coach, Hervé Renard.

title: 'Barbie,' a doll soaked in kitsch mockery
description: Forced to leave her candy-pink world, the heroine discovers the Real World and its widespread sexism in Greta Gerwig's blockbuster.

title: How gentrification is taking over Athens' city center
description: The center of the Greek capital has become a playground for foreign investors buying up entire buildings for seasonal rentals.

title: New Zealand: Two people killed in a shooting hours before Women's Football World Cup kickoff
description: The shooting happened early Thursday morning in Auckland. Security will be heightened ahead of Thursday night's opening game.

title: Moscow threatens Black Sea ships after grain deal exit
description: Following a second night of strikes around the southern Ukrainian port of Odesa, President Zelensky accused Russia of deliberately targeting grain export infrastructure and putting vulnerable countries at risk.

title: A difficult summit in Brussels between Europe, Latin America and the Caribbean
description: As expected, the issue of the war in Ukraine weighed heavily on the debates. On the economic front, the promise of €45 billion of investment in the 33 Latin American and Caribbean countries was welcomed.
